content.raw: Should we use this opportunity to add an expiration to the token?
content.html: Should we use this opportunity to add an expiration to the token?

content.raw: let's do that in a separate pull request
content.html: let's do that in a separate pull request

content.raw: Design point: why not have a list of identities {identities: [.....]} instead of a username and groups? It would make the usage of the token simpler.
content.html: Design point: why not have a list of identities {identities: [.....]} instead of a username and groups? It would make the usage of the token simpler.

content.raw: I agree that treating users and groups the same way can be simpler. My only concern at the moment is that we can't prevent someone creating a group which has the same name as a user. For example, someone could maliciously create a group called "admin", and they'd get all the admin user permissions.
content.html: I agree that treating users and groups the same way can be simpler. My only concern at the moment is that we can't prevent someone creating a group which has the same name as a user. For example, someone could maliciously create a group called "admin", and they'd get all the admin user permissions.

content.raw: good point. Maybe user names and group names should not overlap? e.g. on bitbucket there is no username called osrf as it's already registered as an organization
content.html: good point. Maybe user names and group names should not overlap? e.g. on bitbucket there is no username called osrf as it's already registered as an organization

content.raw: (I clicked on the "Like" button, so just confirming here: +1)
content.html: (I clicked on the "Like" button, so just confirming here: +1)

content.raw: So... If someone creates a group with someone else's email (username), and that person is not in cloudsim yet, the person will never be able to create an account, right?
content.html: So... If someone creates a group with someone else's email (username), and that person is not in cloudsim yet, the person will never be able to create an account, right?

content.raw: I am thinking of just preventing the use of `@` character in group names as a simple solution for now so that we can be sure the group names will not collide with usernames.
content.html: I am thinking of just preventing the use of @ character in group names as a simple solution for now so that we can be sure the group names will not collide with usernames.

content.raw: I like that idea @osrf. We should remember that usernames are also email addresses, so they may also contain the `@` character
content.html: I like that idea @osrf. We should remember that usernames are also email addresses, so they may also contain the @ character

content.raw: changed to token data to use `identities` and added name check when creating groups. 298a3e7
content.html: changed to token data to use identities and added name check when creating groups. 298a3e7

content.raw: wouldn't it be good to verify the token instead of using the response.decoded?
content.html: wouldn't it be good to verify the token instead of using the response.decoded?

content.raw: you mean something like `csgrant.verifyToken`?
content.html: you mean something like csgrant.verifyToken?

content.raw: exactly.
content.html: exactly.

content.raw: done. 298a3e7
content.html: done. 298a3e7

content.html: This should be merged with caution. The cloudsim-grant has to deal with the new token content.
